page.title: 02GEOGRAPHY, BURSTON AREA
page.content: Geology: new red sandstone Relief: undulating, height 80m-188m above sea level;trig pt 162m Climate: marine; mean annual temp. range 6deg C-20deg C max; average annual rainfall 66.5cm Drainage: part of River Trent basin; principal tributaries - Jolpool Brook and Stocking Brook Resources: marl (no longer extracted) Transport: roads - A51, B5066, B5027 canal - Trent & Mersey rail - Rugeley to Stoke-on- Trent. Station Stone Population Distribution: scattered farming community with small villages.
